intro: Ajax propinquus, commonly known as the common ajax, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it demonstrates a high degree of adaptability. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
